question.text: A major limiting factor for photosynthesis in <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants is

solution.text: For <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants, <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> fixation is carried out by enzyme RUBISCO which is highly sensitive to <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> concentration. Increases in <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> concentration increases the rate of photosynthesis and decreases in <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> concentration decreases the rate of photosynthesis.
